institution: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
category: National Human Resources Development Consortium Operating Rules/Article 16 (Performance Evaluation of Joint Training Center)
contents: Article 16 (Performance Evaluation of the Joint Training Center) ① The Chairman shall conduct a performance evaluation of the Joint Training Center in accordance with Article 18-2, Paragraph 1 of the Regulations. However, if the training target number of people is adjusted according to the proviso to Article 13-2, performance evaluation can be conducted on the adjusted target number of people, and the performance evaluation of the joint training center dedicated to training tailored to corporate demand is based on the performance of the existing joint training center. It must be conducted separately from evaluation. Revised March 20, 2020, June 28, 2022, ② For joint training centers with excellent evaluation results pursuant to Paragraph 1, the Chairman shall provide support within 10/100 of the operating cost support limit in Annex 1 of the Regulations (however, corporate demand Separately from the existing joint training center dedicated to customized training, incentives can be provided in the range of 10/100 of the operating cost support limit for training tailored to corporate demand in Appendix 1 of the same rule. In this case, the joint training center may use the incentive money for any of the following purposes. Revised 2020. 3. 20., 2022. 6. 28., 1. Performance bonus for vocational training personnel (hereinafter referred to as *specialized personnel), 2. General operating expenses (however, meal expenses shall be used in the range of 30/100 of the performance bonus) (May be revised) March 20, 2020, 3. Costs related to consortium business, ③ The Chairman may take separate measures against joint training centers with poor evaluation results pursuant to Paragraph 1. In this case, detailed standards are listed in Appendix 5. Follow the “Detailed Standards for Cancellation of Selection and Restrictions on Support, etc. of Joint Training Centers.” ④ The Chairman of the Board may entrust the performance evaluation under paragraph (1) to a support agency for consortium projects under Article 25 (1) of the Regulations or an agency recommended by the Minister of Employment and Labor.
